name: NPR
text:
In July 2019, NPR's @NinaTotenberg sat down with Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg and asked her to reflect on her career.

"I do think that I was born under a very bright star," she said, recounting the obstacles that faced her. https://t.co/UOQ2O3C3QZ https://t.co/pnVLivedkL

text:

name: NPR
text:
NEW: Joe Biden says the Senate shouldn't take up the Supreme Court vacancy opened by Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg's death until after the election.

name: NPR
text:
Chuck Schumer on Twitter said "this vacancy should not be filled until we have a new president" â€” a direct quote of a remark made by Mitch McConnell, who famously blocked Merrick Garland's nomination after Antonin Scalia's death in 2016.
https://t.co/zNOKNVbdgT

name: NPR
text: With a world that's getting hotter, the costs of natural disasters are going up. But trying to change that could cost a lot, too. Today on #NPRConsiderThis, we look at the risks that come with energy sources with smaller carbon footprints. https://t.co/OYXG9fxh8s

text:

name: NPR
text:
Ruth Bader Ginsburg's famous exercise regimen might not have happened if it weren't for her late-husband, Marty.

"I didn't want to do it," Ginsburg told NPR in 2019. "I was exhausted, and Marty said, 'You do it.'"
https://t.co/MykVtI7BVM

name: NPR
text: Wearing a mask is required of all travelers at airports, but some have gone above and beyond, donning a full-body coveralls. How much extra protection do these provide? https://t.co/Nhv10hFYq5

name: NPR
text:
Since 1971, Ruth Bader Ginsburg shared a close friendship with NPR's Nina Totenberg. 

Ginsburg showed "extraordinary character, decency, and commitment to friends, colleagues, law clerks â€” just about everyone whose lives she touched," Totenberg writes. https://t.co/gGoSSDPXIH

name: NPR
text: The death of Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg promises a tumultuous political battle over who will succeed her. https://t.co/nj06gl7t2o

name: NPR
text: "I found myself convinced last night, as Justice Ginsburg's death was reported, that this year the cry of the shofar horn somehow heralds her passing," writes NPR's Scott Simon. https://t.co/Altm3yiTOh

text: President Trump tweeted that a replacement for Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg will be nominated "without delay."
